Executive Board shall submit proposals , recommendations may thereon , Health Assembly .  .  budget following financial period shall approved Health Assembly year preceding biennium budget proposals relate , consideration report proposals appropriate main committee Health Assembly .  .  Director-General , time session Executive Board submits budget proposals recommendations thereon Health Assembly , information indicates may , time Health Assembly , need alter proposals light developments , shall report thereon Executive Board , shall consider including recommendations Health Assembly appropriate provision therefore .  .  developments subsequent session Executive Board considers budget proposals , recommendations made , necessitate render desirable opinion Director-General alteration budget proposals , Director-General shall report thereon Health Assembly .  .  Supplementary proposals may submitted Board Director-General whenever necessary increase appropriations previously approved Health Assembly . proposals shall submitted form manner consistent budget proposals financial period . Regulation IV – Budget Approval  .  budget approved Health Assembly shall constitute authorization Director-General incur contractual obligations make payments purposes budget approved amounts approved , subject available funding .  .  budget approved , commitments made Director-General financial period relate delivery financial period subsequent calendar year , subject available funding .      FINANCIAL REGULATIONS      .  Director-General authorized , prior concurrence Executive Board committee may delegate appropriate authority , transfer credits sections . Executive Board committee may delegated appropriate authority session , Director-General authorized , prior written concurrence majority members Board committee , transfer credits sections . Director-General shall report transfers Executive Board next session .  .  time budget proposals approved exchange rate facility shall established Health Assembly , shall set maximum level may available protect losses foreign exchange . purpose facility shall make possible maintain level budget activities represented budget approved Health Assembly may carried irrespective effect fluctuation currencies United States dollar official United Nations exchange rate . Regulation V – Provision Budget Funds  .  budget shall financed assessed contributions Members , according scale assessments determined Health Assembly , voluntary contributions , projected interest earned , prior period collection arrears income attributable regular budget . Members ’ financial obligations Article    Constitution limited assessed contributions .  .  Health Assembly shall approve amount financed assessed contributions Member States , shall approve amount raised Director-General voluntary sources .  . .  amount financed assessed contributions Members shall calculated adjusting total amount approved Health Assembly reflect proportion budget financed sources noted  .  .  .  event total financing budget less amount approved Health Assembly budget proposals , Director-General shall review implementation plans budget order make adjustments may necessary .  .  Assessed contributions made available implementation   January year financial period . Voluntary contributions made available implementation upon recording agreements resource contributors .          BASIC DOCUMENTS  .  Director-General shall submit Health Assembly annual reports collection contributions ( voluntary assessed ) , sources cash . Regulation VI – Assessed Contributions  .  assessed contributions Members based scale assessments shall divided two equal annual instalments . first year financial period , Health Assembly may decide amend scale assessments applied second year financial period .  .  Health Assembly adopted budget , Director- General shall inform Members commitments respect assessed contributions financial period request pay first second instalments contributions .  .  Health Assembly decides amend scale assessments , adjust amount budget financed assessed contributions Members second year biennium , Director-General shall inform Members revised commitments shall request Members pay revised second instalment contributions .  .  Instalments assessed contributions shall due payable   January year relate .  .    January following year , unpaid balance assessed contributions shall considered one year arrears .  .  total annual assessed contributions Member US $         greater , Member ’ contributions shall assessed half United States dollars half Swiss francs . total annual assessed contributions Member less US $         , Member ’ contributions shall assessed United States dollars . contributions shall paid either United States dollars , euros Swiss francs , currency currencies Director-General shall determine .  .  acceptance Director-General currency fully convertible shall subject specific , annual approval case-by-case basis Director-General . approvals include terms conditions Director-General considers necessary protect World Health Organization .  .  Payments made Member assessed contributions shall credited Member ’ account applied first oldest amount outstanding .      FINANCIAL REGULATIONS      .  Payments assessed contributions currencies United States dollars shall credited Members ’ accounts United Nations rate exchange ruling date receipt World Health Organization .  .   New Members shall required make assessed contribution financial period become Members rates determined Health Assembly . contributions shall recorded income year due . Regulation VII – Working Capital Fund Internal Borrowing  .  Pending receipt assessed contributions , implementation part budget financed contributions may financed Working Capital Fund thereafter internal borrowing . amount Working Capital Fund approved Health Assembly . Internal borrowing may made available cash reserves Organization , excluding Trust Funds .  .  level Working Capital Fund shall based projection financing requirements taking consideration projected income expenditure assessed contributions . proposals Director- General may make Health Assembly varying level Working Capital Fund previously approved shall accompanied explanation demonstrating need change .  .  repayments borrowing Regulation  .  shall made collection arrears assessed contributions shall credited first internal borrowing outstanding secondly borrowing outstanding Working Capital Fund . Regulation VIII – Revenue : Sources  .  Director-General delegated authority , Article    Constitution , accept gifts bequests , either cash kind , provided determined contributions used Organization , conditions may attached consistent objective policies Organization .  .  Director-General authorized levy charge extrabudgetary contributions accordance applicable resolution Health Assembly . charge shall credited Special Account Servicing Costs , together interest earnings earnings investments extrabudgetary contributions , used reimburse , part , indirect costs incurred Organization respect          BASIC DOCUMENTS generation administration resources . direct costs implementation programmes financed extrabudgetary resources shall charged relevant budget . Regulation IX – Funds  .  Funds shall established enable Organization record income expenditure . funds shall cover sources income : regular budget , extrabudgetary resources , Trust Funds , source income may appropriate .  .  Accounts shall established amounts received donors extrabudgetary contributions Trust Funds relevant income expenditures may recorded reported upon .  .  accounts shall established necessary reserves meet requirements administration Organization , including capital expenditure .  .  Director-General may establish revolving funds activities may operated self-financing basis . purpose accounts shall reported Health Assembly , including details sources income expenditures charged funds , disposition surplus balance end financial period .  .  purpose account established Regulations  .   .  shall specified shall subject Financial Regulations Financial Rules established Director-General Regulation   .  , prudent financial management , specific conditions agreed appropriate authority . Regulation X – Custody Cash Cash Equivalents   .  Director-General shall designate bank banks financial institutions cash cash equivalents custody Organization shall kept .   .  Director-General may designate investment ( asset ) managers and/or custodians Organization may wish appoint management cash cash equivalents custody .      FINANCIAL REGULATIONS     Regulation XI – Investment Cash Cash Equivalents   .  cash required immediate payment may invested may pooled far benefits return may generated .   .  Income investments shall credited income Special Account Servicing Costs accordance Regulation  .  , unless otherwise provided regulations , rules resolutions relating specific fund account .   .  Investment policies guidelines shall drawn accordance best industry practice , due regard preservation capital return requirements Organization . Regulation XII – Internal Control   .  Director-General shall : ( ) establish operating policies procedures order ensure effective financial administration , exercise economy , safeguard assets Organization ; ( b ) designate officers may receive funds , incur financial commitments make payments behalf Organization ; ( c ) maintain effective internal control structure ensure accomplishment established objectives goals operations ; economical efficient use resources ; reliability integrity information ; compliance policies , plans , procedures , rules regulations ; safeguarding assets ; ( ) maintain internal audit function responsible review , evaluation monitoring adequacy effectiveness Organization ’ overall systems internal control . purpose , systems , processes , operations , functions activities within Organization shall subject review , evaluation monitoring . Regulation XIII – Accounts Financial Statements   .  Director-General shall establish accounts necessary shall maintain accordance International Public Sector Accounting Standards .   .  Financial statements shall prepared annually accordance International Public Sector Accounting Standards , together          BASIC DOCUMENTS information may necessary indicate current financial position Organization .   .  financial statements shall presented United States dollars . accounting records may , however , kept currency currencies Director-General may deem necessary .   .  financial statements shall submitted External Auditor ( ) later    March following end year relate .   .  Director-General may make ex gratia payments deemed necessary interest Organization . statement payments shall included final accounts .   .  Director-General may authorize , full investigation , writing-off loss asset , arrears contributions . statement losses written shall included final accounts . Regulation XIV – External Audit   .  External Auditor ( ) , shall Auditor-General ( officer holding equivalent title status ) Member government , shall appointed Health Assembly . term office shall four years , covering two budgetary periods , renewed additional term four years . External Auditor ( ) appointed may removed Assembly .   .  Subject special direction Health Assembly , audit External Auditor ( ) performs/perform shall conducted conformity generally accepted common auditing standards accordance Additional Terms Reference set Appendix Regulations .   .  External Auditor ( ) may make observations respect efficiency financial procedures , accounting system , internal financial controls , general , administration management Organization .   .  External Auditor ( ) shall completely independent solely responsible conduct audit , except permitted Regulation   .  , local special examination .   .  Health Assembly may request External Auditor ( ) perform certain specific examinations issue separate reports results .   .  Director-General shall provide External Auditor ( ) facilities required performance audit .      FINANCIAL REGULATIONS       .  purpose making local special examination effecting economies audit cost , External Auditor ( ) may engage services national Auditor-General ( equivalent title ) commercial public auditors known repute person firm , opinion External Auditor ( ) , technically qualified .   .  External Auditor ( ) shall issue report audit annual financial statements prepared Director-General pursuant Regulation XIII . report shall include information he/she/they deem ( ) necessary regard Regulation   .  Additional Terms Reference .   .  report ( ) External Auditor ( ) shall transmitted Executive Board , together audited financial statements , Health Assembly later   May following end financial year final accounts relate . Executive Board shall examine annual financial statements audit report ( ) shall forward Health Assembly comments deems necessary . Regulation XV – Resolutions involving Expenditures   .  Neither Health Assembly Executive Board shall take decision involving expenditures unless report Director-General administrative financial implications proposal .   .  , opinion Director-General , proposed expenditure made existing appropriations , shall incurred Health Assembly made necessary appropriations . Regulation XVI – General Provisions   .  Regulations shall effective date approval Health Assembly , unless otherwise specified Health Assembly . may amended Health Assembly .   .  case doubt interpretation application foregoing Regulations , Director-General authorized rule thereon , subject confirmation Executive Board next session .   .  Financial Rules established Director-General referred Regulation  .  , amendments made Director-General rules , shall enter force confirmation Executive Board . shall reported upon Health Assembly information .          BASIC DOCUMENTS Appendix ADDITIONAL TERMS REFERENCE GOVERNING EXTERNAL AUDIT WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION   . External Auditor ( ) shall perform audit accounts World Health Organization , including Trust Funds special accounts , deemed necessary order satisfy himself/herself/themselves : ( ) financial statements accord books records Organization ; ( b ) financial transactions reflected statements accordance rules regulations , budgetary provisions , applicable directives ; ( c ) securities moneys deposit hand verified certificates received direct Organization ’ depositaries actual count ; ( ) internal controls , including internal audit , adequate light extent reliance placed thereon ; ( e ) procedures satisfactory External Auditor ( ) applied recording assets , liabilities , surpluses deficits .   . External Auditor ( ) shall sole judge acceptance whole part certifications representations Secretariat may proceed detailed examination verification he/she/they choose ( ) financial records including relating supplies equipment .   . External Auditor ( ) staff shall free access convenient times books , records documentation , opinion External Auditor ( ) , necessary performance audit . Information classified privileged Secretariat agrees required External Auditor ( ) purposes audit , information classified confidential , shall made available application . External Auditor ( ) staff shall respect privileged confidential nature information classified made available shall make use except direct connection performance audit . External Auditor ( ) may draw attention Health Assembly denial information classified privileged , his/her/their opinion , required purpose audit .   . External Auditor ( ) shall power disallow items accounts shall draw attention Director-General appropriate action transaction creates doubt legality propriety . Audit objections , transactions , arising examination accounts shall immediately communicated Director-General .   . External Auditor ( ) shall express sign opinion financial statements Organization . opinion shall include following basic elements : ( ) identification financial statements audited ; ( b ) reference responsibility entity ’ management responsibility External Auditor ( ) ; ( c ) reference audit standards followed ; ( ) description work performed ; ( e ) expression opinion financial statements whether : ( ) financial statements present fairly financial position end period results operations period ; ( ii ) financial statements prepared accordance stated accounting policies ; ( iii ) accounting policies applied basis consistent preceding financial period ; ( f ) expression opinion compliance transactions Financial Regulations legislative authority ; ( g ) date opinion ; ( h ) External Auditor ’ ( ’ ) name position ; ( ) place report signed ; ( j ) necessary , reference report External Auditor ( ) financial statements .      FINANCIAL REGULATIONS       . report External Auditor ( ) Health Assembly financial operations period mention : ( ) type scope examination ; ( b ) matters affecting completeness accuracy accounts , including appropriate : ( ) information necessary correct interpretation accounts ; ( ii ) amounts ought received brought account ; ( iii ) amounts legal contingent obligation exists recorded reflected financial statements ; ( iv ) expenditures properly substantiated ; ( v ) whether proper books accounts kept ; presentation statements deviations material nature consistent application generally accepted accounting principles , disclosed ; ( c ) matters brought notice Health Assembly : ( ) cases fraud presumptive fraud ; ( ii ) wasteful improper expenditure Organization ’ money assets ( notwithstanding accounting transaction may correct ) ; ( iii ) expenditure likely commit Organization outlay large scale ; ( iv ) defect general system detailed regulations governing control receipts disbursements , supplies equipment ; ( v ) expenditure accordance intention Health Assembly , making allowance duly authorized transfers within budget ; ( vi ) expenditure excess appropriations amended duly authorized transfers within budget ; ( vii ) expenditure conformity authority governs ; ( ) accuracy otherwise supplies equipment records determined stocktaking examination records . addition , report may contain reference : ( e ) transactions accounted previous financial period , concerning information obtained , transactions later financial period concerning seems desirable Health Assembly early knowledge .   . External Auditor ( ) may make observations respect his/her/their findings resulting audit comments financial report he/she/they deem ( ) appropriate Health Assembly Director-General .   . Whenever External Auditor ’ ( ’ ) scope audit restricted , insufficient evidence available , External Auditor ’ ( ’ ) opinion shall refer matter , making clear report reasons comments effect financial position financial transactions recorded . case shall External Auditor ( ) include criticism report without first affording   . Director-General adequate opportunity explanation matter observation .    . External Auditor ( ) is/are required mention matter referred foregoing considered immaterial . ––––––––––      STAFF REGULATIONS WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION  SCOPE PURPOSE Staff Regulations embody fundamental conditions service basic rights , duties obligations World Health Organization Secretariat staff . broad principles personnel policy guidance Director-General staffing administration Secretariat . Director-General may , Chief Administrative Officer , provide enforce Staff Rules consistent principles considers necessary . . DUTIES , OBLIGATIONS PRIVILEGES  .  staff members Organization international civil servants . responsibilities national exclusively international . accepting appointment , pledge discharge functions regulate conduct interests World Health Organization view .  .  staff members subject authority Director-General assignment activities offices World Health Organization . responsible exercise functions . principle , whole time staff members shall disposal Director-General .  .  performance duties staff members shall neither seek accept instructions government authority external Organization .  .  staff member shall accept , hold engage office occupation incompatible proper discharge duties World Health Organization .  .  Staff members shall conduct times manner compatible status international civil servants . shall avoid action particular kind public pronouncement may adversely reflect status . expected give national sentiments political religious convictions , shall _________   Text adopted Fourth World Health Assembly ( resolution WHA .   ) amended Twelfth , Fifty-fifth , Sixty-second , Sixty-eighth , Sixty-ninth Seventy-first World Health Assemblies ( resolutions WHA  .   , WHA  .   , WHA  .  , WHA  .   , WHA  .   WHA  .   , respectively ) . –     –       BASIC DOCUMENTS times bear mind reserve tact incumbent upon reason international status .  .  Staff members shall exercise utmost discretion regard matters official business . shall communicate person information known reason official position made public , except course duties authorization Director-General . time shall way use private advantage information known reason official position . obligations cease separation service .  .  staff member shall accept honour , decoration , favour , gift remuneration government , source external Organization , acceptance incompatible status international civil servant .  .  staff member becomes candidate public office political character shall resign Secretariat .  .  immunities privileges attaching World Health Organization virtue Article    Constitution conferred interests Organization . privileges immunities furnish excuse staff members non-performance private obligations failure observe laws police regulations . decision whether waive privileges immunities staff case arises shall rest Director-General .  .   staff members shall subscribe following oath declaration : solemnly swear ( undertake , affirm , promise ) exercise loyalty , discretion , conscience functions entrusted international civil servant World Health Organization , discharge functions regulate conduct interests World Health Organization view , seek accept instructions regard performance duties government authority external Organization .  .   oath declaration shall made orally Director-General public meeting World Health Assembly , Deputy Director-General , Assistant Director-General Regional Director Director-General writing staff members .      STAFF REGULATIONS     II . CLASSIFICATION POSTS STAFF  .  Appropriate provision shall made Director-General classification posts staff according nature duties responsibilities required . III . SALARIES RELATED ALLOWANCES  .  salaries Deputy Director-General , Assistant Director-General Regional Director shall determined World Health Assembly recommendation Director-General advice Executive Board . levels staff shall determined   .  Salary Director-General basis duties responsibilities . salary allowance plan shall determined Director-General following basically scales salaries allowances United Nations , provided staff occupying positions subject local recruitment Director-General may establish salaries allowances accordance best prevailing local practices staff occupying positions subject international recruitment remuneration shall varied duty stations take account relative cost living staff members concerned , standards living related factors . deviations United Nations scales salaries allowances may necessary requirements World Health Organization shall subject approval , may authorized , Executive Board . IV . APPOINTMENT , TRANSFER , REASSIGNMENT PROMOTION  .  Director-General shall appoint , transfer , reassign promote staff members required without regard race , sex religion .  .  paramount consideration transfer , reassignment promotion staff members shall necessity securing highest standards efficiency , competence integrity . Due regard shall paid importance recruiting staff members wide geographical basis possible . appointment ,   .  far practicable , selection shall made competitive basis ; however , foregoing shall apply filling positions transfer reassignment staff member without promotion interest Organization .           BASIC DOCUMENTS  .  Without prejudice inflow fresh talent , posts shall filled reassignment staff members , defined , conditions established , Director-General , preference persons . preference shall also applied , reciprocal basis , United Nations specialized agencies brought relationship United Nations .  .  appointment Deputy Director-General , Assistant Director-General Regional Director shall period exceed five years , subject renewal , accordance conditions determined Executive Board concerning eligibility Regional Directors reappointment . staff members shall granted appointments duration terms conditions , consistent regulations , Director-General may prescribe .  .  Director-General shall establish appropriate medical standards prospective staff members shall normally required meet appointment . V. ANNUAL SPECIAL LEAVE  .  Staff members shall allowed appropriate annual leave . exceptional cases , special leave may authorized Director-General .  .  order staff members may take leave periodically home countries , Organization shall allow necessary travelling time purpose , conditions definitions prescribed  Director-General . VI . SOCIAL SECURITY  .  Provision shall made participation staff members United Nations Joint Staff Pension Fund accordance regulations fund .  .  Director-General shall establish scheme social security staff , including provisions health protection , sick leave maternity leave , reasonable compensation event illness , accident death attributable performance official duties behalf Organization . STAFF REGULATIONS     VII . TRAVEL REMOVAL EXPENSES conditions definitions prescribed  .  Subject  Director-General , Organization shall pay travel expenses staff members , appropriate cases , dependants upon appointment subsequent change official duty station , upon taking leave home authorized , upon separation service .  .  Subject conditions definitions prescribed Director- General , World Health Organization shall pay removal costs staff members upon appointment subsequent change official duty station upon separation service . VIII . STAFF RELATIONS  .  Director-General shall make provision staff participation discussion policies relating staff questions . IX . SEPARATION SERVICE  .  Staff members may resign Secretariat upon giving Director-General notice required terms appointment .  .  Director-General may terminate appointment staff member accordance terms appointment , necessities service require abolition post reduction staff , services staff member prove unsatisfactory , refuses , fails take , reasonable reassignment , reasons health , incapacitated service .  .  Director-General terminates appointment staff member shall given notice indemnity payment accordance terms appointment .  .  Director-General shall establish scheme payment repatriation grants .  .  Normally , staff members shall retained active service beyond age specified Pension Fund regulations age retirement . Director-General may , interests Organization , extend age limit exceptional cases .           BASIC DOCUMENTS X. DISCIPLINARY MEASURES   .  Director-General may impose disciplinary measures staff members whose conduct unsatisfactory . may summarily dismiss member staff serious misconduct . XI . DISPUTE RESOLUTION   .  Director-General shall establish administrative machinery staff participation advise case appeal staff members administrative decision alleging non-observance terms appointment , including pertinent regulations rules , disciplinary action .   .  dispute resolved internally , arising Organization member staff regarding fulfilment contract said member , shall referred final decision Administrative Tribunal International Labour Organization . XII . GENERAL PROVISIONS   .  regulations may supplemented amended Health Assembly , without prejudice acquired rights staff members .   .  Director-General shall report annually Health Assembly staff rules amendments thereto may make implement regulations , confirmation Executive Board .   .  Director-General , virtue authority vested chief technical administrative officer Organization , may delegate officers Organization powers considers necessary effective implementation regulations .   .  case doubt meaning foregoing regulations , Director-General authorized rule thereon subject confirmation ruling Executive Board next meeting . ––––––––––       REGULATIONS EXPERT ADVISORY PANELS COMMITTEES  INTRODUCTION Efficiency , well economy , makes necessary limit number experts participating discussions given subject ; hand , difficult , small group experts , obtain adequate representation various branches knowledge bear upon subject , diversified forms local experience trends thought prevailing various parts world . apparently conflicting requirements may reconciled giving expert committees , whenever desirable , flexible membership . may done setting advisory panels experts conversant required branches knowledge forms experience needed cover adequately particular subject providing adequate geographical representation . panels drawn members expert committees , selection made according agenda meeting . following regulations , therefore , based principles .   . DEFINITIONS  .  expert advisory panel consists experts Organization may obtain technical guidance support within particular subject , either correspondence meetings experts may invited .  .  member expert advisory panel expert appointed Director-General undertakes contribute correspondence technical information developments field , offer advice appropriate , spontaneously upon request .  .  expert committee group expert advisory panel members convened Director-General purpose reviewing making technical recommendations subject interest Organization . _________   Text adopted Thirty-fifth World Health Assembly ( resolution WHA  .   ) , replacement regulations adopted Fourth World Health Assembly . Amendments adopted Forty-fifth , Forty-ninth , Fifty-third Fifty-fifth World Health Assemblies ( decision WHA   (    ) , resolution WHA  .   , resolution WHA  .  resolution WHA  .   , respectively ) . –     –       BASIC DOCUMENTS  .  member expert committee expert appointed Director-General serve particular meeting committee .   . AUTHORITY ESTABLISH EXPERT ADVISORY PANELS COMMITTEES  .  expert advisory panel may established Director-General field required development Organization ’ programme . established Organization whole shall utilized whatever level operation guidance support needed . expert advisory panel may disestablished Director-General discretion guidance support longer required .  .  Director-General shall report Executive Board establishment disestablishment expert advisory panels membership .  .  World Health Assembly Executive Board authority Articles    ( e )    Constitution Organization establish dissolve expert committees .  .  Director-General shall include biennial programme budget proposals expert committee meetings deems necessary .   . EXPERT ADVISORY PANELS – MEMBERSHIP PROCEDURES  .  person possessing qualifications and/or experience relevant useful activities Organization field covered established expert advisory panel may considered appointment member panel consultations national authorities concerned . Information appointments made panels shall circulated Member States . Director-General shall encourage developing countries send nominations panels .  .  selection members expert advisory panels Director- General shall consider primarily technical ability experience , shall also endeavour ensure panels broadest possible international representation terms diversity knowledge , experience approaches fields panels established . He/she shall encourage nomination experts developing countries regions shall helped task Regional Directors .      REGULATIONS EXPERT ADVISORY PANELS COMMITTEES      .  Members expert advisory panels shall appointed period Director-General may determine , exceeding four years .  . .  expiration period , appointment shall end . However , Director-General may renew appointment renewal warranted specific programme requirements . Renewals appointments fixed periods four years .  . .  appointment shall also end panel disestablished . may also terminated time Director-General interests Organization require . Director-General shall report Executive Board early termination appointment .  .  Members expert advisory panels receive remuneration Organization . However , attending meetings invitation , shall entitled , accordance administrative regulations Organization , reimbursement travelling expenses daily living allowance meetings .   . EXPERT COMMITTEES – MEMBERSHIP PROCEDURES Selection , Appointment Term Office Members  .  Director-General shall establish number experts invited meeting expert committee , determine date duration , convene committee .  .  general rule , Director-General shall select one expert advisory panels members expert committee basis principles equitable geographical representation , gender balance , balance experts developed developing countries , representation different trends thought , approaches practical experience various parts world , appropriate interdisciplinary balance . membership expert committees shall restricted consideration language , within range languages Organization .  .  Members expert advisory panel invited particular meeting expert committee interest may request attend observers , authorized Director-General , shall expense . United Nations system , well  .  Organizations nongovernmental organizations official relations , may invited send representatives expert committee meetings directly interested .     BASIC DOCUMENTS  .  ensure balanced geographical representation , consultants temporary advisers assigned assist expert committee shall selected , far possible , countries represented committee ’ membership . International Status Members  .  exercise functions , members expert advisory panels committees shall act international experts serving Organization exclusively ; capacity may request receive instructions government authority external Organization . Furthermore , shall disclose circumstances could give rise potential conflict interest result membership expert committee , accordance mechanisms established Director- General purpose .  .  shall enjoy privileges immunities envisaged Article    ( b ) Constitution Organization set forth Convention Privileges Immunities Specialized Agencies Annex VII thereof . Agenda  .  Director-General , representative , shall prepare draft agenda meeting transmit reasonable time members committee Executive Board , Members Organization . expert committee , unless formally requested , may deal questions administrative policy . agenda shall include subject , within terms reference committee , proposed Health Assembly , Executive Board Director-General .  .  order provide members expert committee broadest possible information subjects discussion , terms reference annotated agenda meeting shall supplied advance members expert advisory panels conversant subjects invited meeting . may also invited provide written contributions may receive principal working documents . Expert Sub-committees  .   study special problems committee may suggest establishment , temporarily permanently , specialized sub-committees , may make suggestions composition . committee may also suggest establishment joint sub-committees consisting specialists      REGULATIONS EXPERT ADVISORY PANELS COMMITTEES     technical field specialists another field whose collaboration considers necessary success work . Health Assembly , Executive Board , shall decide whether sub-committees shall established , whether singly jointly committees sub-committees Organization .  .   rules governing functions committees , appointment members , election chairmen vice-chairmen , secretaryship agenda shall , mutatis mutandis , apply sub-committees . Membership committee entitle expert participate proceedings sub-committees . Reports Meetings Committees  .   meeting expert committee shall draw report setting forth findings , observations recommendations . report shall completed approved expert committee end meeting . conclusions recommendations shall commit Organization formulated way advise Director-General future programme activities without calling upon use staff , services funds Organization specified way . committee unanimous findings , divergent views shall recorded appended report . Signed contributions may included text expert committee ’ report annexes .  .   text expert committee report may modified without committee ’ consent . Director-General may direct attention chairman expert committee statement opinion report might considered prejudicial best interests Organization Member State . chairman committee may , discretion , delete statement report , without communicating members expert committee , , obtaining written approval , may modify statement . difficulty arising divergence views Director-General chairman committee shall referred Executive Board .  .   Director-General shall responsible authorizing publication  Director-General may communicate report directly Health Assembly , opinion , contains information advice urgently required body . reports expert committees . Nevertheless ,  .   Director-General may publish authorize publication document prepared expert committee , due recognition authorship applicable .         BASIC DOCUMENTS Reports Meetings Sub-committees  .   provisions ( paragraphs  .  – .   ) shall apply reports meetings sub-committees , except report sub-committee joint sub-committee shall submitted Director-General parent committee committees . Nevertheless , Director-General may communicate report sub-committee directly Executive Board Health Assembly , opinion , contains information advice urgently required either bodies . Venue Meetings Committees  .   Meetings expert committees shall normally held headquarters order provide overall technical guidance . may also convened regional level , deal problems predominantly regional character , country level , health problems consideration essentially country-specific . Meetings expert committees shall planned coordinated manner complement convened headquarters , avoid duplication , ensure maximum effectiveness coherence work .  .   provisions ( paragraphs  . – .   ) shall applicable , mutatis mutandis , expert committees meet regional country level . Director-General may delegate necessary authority Regional Directors . Rules Procedure  .   Expert committees sub-committees shall conduct  proceedings accordance Rules Procedure set forth annex regulations . Joint Committees Sub-committees  .   selection appointment expert advisory panel members designated Director-General serve joint committee sub-committee convened Organization conjunction organizations shall also governed regulations . selection , account shall taken technical geographical balance desirable joint committee sub-committee whole .  .   Members expert advisory panels appointed Director-General joint committees sub-committees shall retain complete freedom opinion expression . Therefore participation collective decision may entail administrative , financial moral responsibility another participating organization commit Organization . REGULATIONS EXPERT ADVISORY PANELS COMMITTEES      .   Members expert advisory panels representing Organization joint committee sub-committee shall report Director-General participation . report shall supplementary collective report joint committee sub-committee . Reporting Executive Board  .   Director-General shall submit Executive Board report meetings expert committees held since previous session Board . shall contain observations implications expert committee reports recommendations follow-up action taken , texts recommendations expert committee shall annexed . Executive Board shall consider report submitted Director-General address comments .   . ENTRY-INTO-FORCE  .  regulations shall apply date approval Health Assembly . Annex RULES PROCEDURE EXPERT COMMITTEES PRIVATE NATURE MEETINGS Rule   meetings expert committees shall normally private character . become public except express decision committee full agreement Director-General . QUORUM Rule   discussions expert committee shall valid : ( ) least two-thirds members present ; ( b ) , unless otherwise authorized Director-General , representative Director-General also present .         BASIC DOCUMENTS CHAIRMAN , VICE-CHAIRMAN RAPPORTEUR Rule   expert committee shall elect , among members , chairman direct debates , vice-chairman replace chairman necessary , rapporteur . SECRETARYSHIP Rule     . accordance Article    Constitution Organization , Director-General ex officio secretary expert committees . may delegate functions technical officer competent subject concerned .   . Director-General , representative , may time make either oral written statements committee concerning question consideration .   . Director-General , representative , shall determine time place meeting shall convene committee .   . committee ’ secretariat , composed secretary staff members , consultants temporary advisers , required , shall assist chairman , rapporteur members committee . AGENDA Rule     . secretary meeting shall prepare draft agenda , submit Director-General approval , transmit members committee together letter invitation meeting .   . agenda shall include subject within terms reference committee proposed Health Assembly , Executive Board Director-General .      REGULATIONS EXPERT ADVISORY PANELS COMMITTEES     VOTE Rule   Scientific questions shall submitted vote . members committee agree , shall entitled personal opinion reflected report ; statement opinion shall take form individual group report , stating reasons divergent opinion held . CONDUCT BUSINESS Rule   Save provided Rule   , chairman shall guided provisions Rules Procedure Executive Board conduct business voting committee far may necessary accomplishment work committee . REPORTS Rule   expert committee shall draw approve report closure meeting . WORKING LANGUAGES Rule     . working languages expert committee shall English French . Secretariat shall make arrangements necessary provide interpretation official languages Health Assembly Executive Board .   . expert committees held regional country level , working languages region English French may chosen committee ’ working languages ; arrangements may made interpretation languages required . ––––––––––     REGULATIONS STUDY SCIENTIFIC GROUPS , COLLABORATING INSTITUTIONS MECHANISMS COLLABORATION  INTRODUCTION World Health Organization requires expert advice overall scientific technical guidance , well direct support global , interregional regional technical cooperation programmes national health development . advice support must reflect high scientific technical standards , widest possible representation different branches knowledge , local experience trends thought throughout world , must cover broad range disciplines related health social development . Expert advice support may obtained provided individuals , groups institutions . present regulations cover : ( ) advice obtained members expert advisory panels acting individually collaborating expert committees ;   ( b ) expert advice available informally ; ( c ) expertise provided regional level problems regional subregional character ; ( ) advice obtained channels covered regulations ( e.g . non-governmental organizations ) ; ( e ) scientific technical meetings expert committees , study groups scientific groups , especially meetings concerned adapted special programmes ( e.g . Special Programme Research Training Tropical Diseases , Special Programme Research , Development Research Training Human Reproduction , Diarrhoeal Diseases Control Programme , International Programme Chemical Safety ) . _________   Text approved Executive Board sixty-ninth session ( resolution EB  .R   ) amendments approved    th session ( resolution EB   .R  ) .   regulations expert advisory panels committees , see pp .    –    . –     –       BASIC DOCUMENTS Adherence principles underlying regulations essential , practical application must responsive evolving demands Organization , new ways means securing using expertise may prove necessary .   . STUDY GROUPS  .  Study groups may convened instead expert committees one following conditions met : – knowledge subject studied still uncertain opinions competent specialists diverse reasonable expectation authoritative conclusions immediately utilized Organization ; – study envisaged concerns limited aspect general problem , may may come within purview expert committee ; – study envisaged implies collaboration narrowly specialized participants may belong different disciplines Organization occasionally calls , without necessary , however , include expert advisory panels ; – certain non-technical factors render unsuitable expert committee meeting , would official character ; – urgent exceptional circumstances call administrative procedure simpler rapidly applicable involved meetings expert committees .  .  Director-General authority convene study groups , determine nature scope subjects , date duration meetings , membership , whether reports published . , Director-General shall follow , whenever applicable far practicable , principles rules applicable expert committees , particularly concerning technical geographical balance groups . Members study groups may members expert advisory panels experts .  .  regulations applying reports documents expert committees shall also apply reports documents study groups .  .  Meetings study groups may held regional level , deal subjects essentially regional interest , one REGULATIONS STUDY SCIENTIFIC GROUPS     conditions outlined paragraph  .  met . study groups may convened Regional Directors , apply provisions regulation  .  , mutatis mutandis , ensure optimal coordination study group meetings meetings related subjects regions headquarters level .  .  study group convened conjunction another organization , Regulations  .    .   concerning expert advisory panels committees shall apply , mutatis mutandis .  .  exercise functions members expert advisory panels experts participating study group meetings shall act international experts serving Organization exclusively ; capacity may request receive instructions government authority external Organization . shall enjoy privileges immunities envisaged Article    ( b ) Constitution Organization set forth Convention Privileges Immunities Specialized Agencies Annex VII thereof .   . SCIENTIFIC GROUPS  .  functions scientific groups review given fields medical , health health systems research , assess current state knowledge fields , determine knowledge may best extended . words , scientific groups play research role comparable expert committees study groups Organization ’ programme general .  .  Director-General authority convene scientific groups determine nature scope subjects , date duration meetings , membership . , Director-General follow , whenever applicable far practicable , principles rules applicable expert committees . Members scientific groups may members expert advisory panels experts .  .  Director-General shall submit reports scientific groups global Advisory Committee Health Research,  reports may published discretion .  .  Meetings scientific groups may held regional level , deal subjects essentially regional interest . scientific groups may convened Regional Directors , apply provisions _________   former title ( Advisory Committee Medical Research ) changed Thirty-ninth World Health Assembly decision WHA   (   ) .          BASIC DOCUMENTS Regulation  .  , mutatis mutandis , ensure optimal coordination scientific group meetings meetings related subjects regions headquarters level .  .  scientific group convened conjunction another organization , regulations  .    .   concerning expert advisory panels committees shall apply , mutatis mutandis .  .  exercise functions members expert advisory panels experts participating scientific group meetings shall act international experts serving Organization exclusively ; capacity may request receive instructions government authority external Organization . shall enjoy privileges immunities envisaged Article    ( b ) Constitution Organization set forth Convention Privileges Immunities Specialized Agencies Annex VII thereof .  . COLLABORATING CENTRES Definition Functions  .  collaborating centre institution designated Director-General form part international collaborative network carrying activities support Organization ’ programme levels . department laboratory within institution group facilities reference , research training belonging different institutions may designated centre , one institution acting relations Organization .  .  Institutions showing growing capacity fulfil function functions related Organization ’ programme , well institutions high scientific technical standing attained international recognition , may qualify designation collaborating centres .  .  functions collaborating centres , severally collectively , include following : ( ) collection , collation dissemination information ; ( b ) standardization terminology nomenclature , technology , diagnostic , therapeutic prophylactic substances , methods procedures ; ( c ) development application appropriate technology ; ( ) provision reference substances services ;      REGULATIONS STUDY SCIENTIFIC GROUPS     ( e ) participation collaborative research developed Organization ’ planning , conduct , monitoring evaluation research , well promotion application results research ; leadership , including ( f ) training , including research training ; ( g ) coordination activities carried several institutions given subject .  .  collaborating centre participates contractual basis cooperative programmes supported Organization country , intercountry , regional , interregional global levels . also contributes increasing technical cooperation among countries providing information , services advice , stimulating supporting research training . Designation  .  criteria applied selection institutions designation collaborating centre follows : ( ) scientific technical standing institution concerned national international levels ; ( b ) place institution occupies country ’ health , scientific educational structures ; ( c ) quality scientific technical leadership , number qualifications staff ; ( ) institution ’ prospective stability terms personnel , activity funding ; ( e ) working relationship institution developed institutions country , well intercountry , regional global levels ; ( f ) institution ’ ability , capacity readiness contribute , individually within networks , programme activities , whether support country programmes participating international cooperative activities ; ( g ) technical geographical relevance institution activities ’ programme priorities ; ( h ) successful completion institution least two years collaboration carrying jointly planned activities .          BASIC DOCUMENTS  .  Regional Directors shall propose institutions designation collaborating centres Director-General . shall basis preliminary exploration institutions national authorities concerned advice suggestions Organization ’ programme officers responsible , global regional level , programmes concerned .  .  Regional Directors shall provide appropriate information concerning : Director-General ( ) programme requirements prospective centre expected respond functions perform ; ( b ) suitability institution concerned , basis criteria laid regulations Director-General ;  ( c ) government ’ institution ’ agreement proposed designation .  .  Designation shall agreement administrative head institution consultation national authorities . designation shall signified institution national authorities Regional Director concerned .  .  designation , institution shall known official title “ Collaborating Centre ” , followed concise indication sphere activity covered .  .   collaborating centres shall designated initial period four years . designation renewable shorter periods , warranted programme requirements results evaluation . Management  .   Collaboration centres shall managed relevant programme officers part Organization initiated designation process , whether headquarters region . Collaborating centres , however , shall maintain technical links parts Organization relevant agreed programme work .   . NATIONAL INSTITUTIONS RECOGNIZED  .  collaborative activities scope nature may warrant designation collaborating centre , Organization may propose institution able willing participate      REGULATIONS STUDY SCIENTIFIC GROUPS     activities designated national authorities concerned purpose .  .  Upon designation national authorities , institution shall formally acknowledged Organization national institution recognized . However , reference may included title institution .  .  agreement shall specify tasks performed institution technical contributions provided Organization .  .  Official recognition Organization shall one year shall tacitly renewed unless notice given either party three months advance .  .  acknowledgement recognition national institution shall signified government institution concerned Regional Director . Working technical relationships institution shall developed regional headquarters level , appropriate .  .  National institutions recognized shall authorized respective governments , authorization necessary , maintain direct working relations Organization collaborating centres .   . MECHANISMS COLLABORATION  .  mechanisms collaboration individual experts , expert groups institutions – example contractual technical service agreement – developed Organization response particular requirements .  .  mechanisms mostly based close involvement individual experts , expert groups institutions definition programme objectives , formulation strategic plans attain objectives , implementation plans , monitoring progress .  .  Director-General shall apply mechanisms working procedures deems effective , even though procedures may differ provided regulations pertaining expert advisory panels committees . mechanisms , however , shall general conformity principles outlined regulations ,          BASIC DOCUMENTS especially concerning adequate international technical distribution expertise .  .  new developments Organization ’ collaboration individual experts , expert groups institutions shall subjected monitoring evaluation procedures outlined .   . MONITORING EVALUATION  .  development individual , collective institutional mechanisms expert guidance support , Organization must able rely adequate monitoring evaluation procedures .  .  Director-General shall develop procedures , using full technical resources Secretariat well scientific technical advisory bodies dealing various aspects Organization ’ programme , particular global regional advisory committees health research.   .  Director-General shall report Executive Board , time time , results obtained difficulties encountered giving effect regulations , shall propose action ensure maximum effectiveness . –––––––––– _________   See footnote   , p.     .       RULES PROCEDURE WORLD HEALTH ASSEMBLY ,  Note : Whenever following terms appear Rules , reference shall indicated : “ Constitution ” – Constitution World Health Organization “ Organization ” – World Health Organization “ Health Assembly ” – World Health Assembly “ Board ” – Executive Board “ Members ” – Members World Health Organization “ Associate Members ” – Associate Members World Health Organization “ Financial period ” – period two consecutive calendar years beginning even-numbered year . “ Official relations ” – privilege Executive Board may grant nongovernmental organizations , international business associations philanthropic foundations accordance Framework Engagement Non-State Actors . –––––––––– Preamble Rules Procedure adopted authority , subject , Constitution World Health Organization . event conflict provision Rules provision Constitution , Constitution shall prevail . _________   Text adopted Eighth World Health Assembly ( resolutions WHA . Rule   Director-General shall convene Health Assembly meet special session , within    days receipt request therefor , made majority Members Associate Members Organization Board , time place Board shall determine . Rule   Notices convening regular session Health Assembly shall sent Director-General less    days notices convening special session less    days date fixed opening session , Members Associate Members , representatives Board participating intergovernmental organizations nongovernmental organizations , international business associations philanthropic foundations official relations Organization   invited represented session . Rule   Board shall include provisional agenda regular session Health Assembly inter alia : ( ) annual report Director-General work Organization ; ( b ) items Health Assembly , previous session , ordered included ; ( c ) items pertaining budget next financial period reports accounts preceding year period ; ( ) item proposed Member Associate Member ; ( e ) subject preliminary consultation may necessary Director-General Secretary-General United Nations , item proposed United Nations ; ( f ) item proposed organization United Nations system Organization entered effective relations . Rule   provisional agenda special session shall include items proposed request majority Members Associate Members Organization Board holding session , pursuant Rule   .     BASIC DOCUMENTS Regular special sessions Rule   Director-General shall enter consultation United Nations specialized agencies items , proposed conformity Rules , relating new activities undertaken Organization direct concern organization organizations , shall report Health Assembly means achieving coordinated use resources respective organizations . proposals put forward course session , Director-General shall , consultation may possible representatives United Nations specialized agencies attending session , draw attention Health Assembly full implications proposal . Rule   Health Assembly shall satisfy adequate consultations taken place organizations concerned accordance Rule   taking action new activities . Rule    Director-General shall consult United Nations specialized agencies , well Member States , international conventions agreements international regulations proposed adoption respect provision thereof affects activities organization organizations , shall bring comments organization organizations attention Health Assembly together comments received governments . Rule    Unless Health Assembly decides otherwise case urgency , proposals new activities undertaken Organization may placed upon supplementary agenda session proposals received least six weeks date opening session , proposal one referred another organ Organization examination view deciding whether action Organization desirable . proposal shall accompanied explanatory memorandum . RULES PROCEDURE HEALTH ASSEMBLY     Rule    Subject provisions Rule    regarding new activities provisions Rule    , supplementary item may added agenda session , upon report General Committee Health Assembly decides , provided request inclusion supplementary item reaches Organization later six days prior opening regular session later two days prior opening special session . request shall accompanied explanatory memorandum . Rule    session provisional agenda , subject Rule    , proposed supplementary item , together report General Committee thereon , shall submitted Health Assembly adoption soon possible opening session . Rule    Director-General shall report Health Assembly technical , administrative financial implications agenda items submitted Health Assembly considered Health Assembly plenary meeting . proposal shall considered absence report unless Health Assembly decides otherwise case urgency . Rule    Copies reports documents relating provisional agenda session shall made available internet sent Director-General Members Associate Members participating intergovernmental organizations time provisional agenda less six weeks commencement regular session Health Assembly ; appropriate reports documents shall also sent nongovernmental organizations , international business associations philanthropic foundations official relations Organization manner . Moreover , upon request chief delegate delegate designated President may allow adviser speak particular point , latter shall vote name delegation question . Rule    Plenary meetings Health Assembly shall held public unless Health Assembly decides exceptional circumstances require meeting held private . Health Assembly shall determine participation private meetings beyond delegations Members , representatives Associate Members representative United Nations . Decisions Health Assembly taken private meeting shall announced early public meeting Health Assembly . Rule    Subject decision Health Assembly , Director-General shall make appropriate arrangements admission public representatives Press information agencies plenary meetings Health Assembly . Rule    Member , Associate Member , participating intergovernmental organization nongovernmental organization , international business association philanthropic foundation official relations shall communicate Director-General , possible less    days opening Health Assembly , names representatives . case delegations Members Associate Members , communications shall take form credentials , indicating names delegates , alternates advisers , shall issued Head State , Head Government , Minister Foreign Affairs , Minister Health appropriate authority . credentials may sent electronically hand-delivered Director-General . President shall empowered recommend Health Assembly acceptance credentials received Committee Credentials met . Meetings Committee Credentials shall held private . OFFICERS HEALTH ASSEMBLY Rule    regular session , Health Assembly shall elect President five Vice-Presidents , shall hold office successors elected . Rule    addition exercising powers conferred upon elsewhere Rules , President shall declare opening closing plenary meeting session , shall direct discussions plenary meetings , ensure observance Rules , accord right speak , put questions announce decisions . shall rule points order , , subject Rules , shall control proceedings meeting shall maintain order thereat . President may , course discussion item , propose Health Assembly limitation time allowed speaker closure list speakers . Rule    President may appoint one Vice-Presidents take place meeting part thereof . Vice-President acting President shall powers duties President . RULES PROCEDURE HEALTH ASSEMBLY     President unable perform functions remainder term elected , new President shall elected among five Vice-Presidents Health Assembly unexpired term . President unable act sessions , one Vice- Presidents shall act place . order Vice- Presidents shall requested serve shall determined lot session election takes place . Rule    President , Vice-President acting President , shall vote , may , necessary , appoint another delegate alternate delegate delegation act delegate government plenary meetings . Rule    event neither President Vice-President present opening session , Director-General shall preside ad interim . GENERAL COMMITTEE Rule    General Committee Health Assembly shall consist President Vice-Presidents Health Assembly , Chairs main committees Health Assembly established Rule    number delegates elected Health Assembly shall provide total    members General Committee , provided delegation may one representative Committee . President Health Assembly shall convene , preside , meetings General Committee . member General Committee may accompanied one member delegation . President Vice-President may designate member delegation substitute capacity member meeting part thereof . Chair main committee shall , case absence , designate Vice-Chair committee substitute , provided Vice-Chair shall right vote delegation another member General Committee . elected delegates shall entitled designate     BASIC DOCUMENTS another member delegation act substitute event absence meeting General Committee . Meetings General Committee shall held private unless decides otherwise . Rule     Meetings General Committee may attended one member delegation Health Assembly represented thereon . members may participate without vote deliberations General Committee invited Chair . Rule    addition performing duties specified elsewhere Rules , General Committee , consultation Director-General subject decision Health Assembly , shall : ( ) decide time place plenary meetings , meetings main committees meetings committees established plenary meetings session . Whenever practicable , General Committee shall make known days advance date hour meetings Health Assembly committees ; ( b ) determine order business plenary meeting session ; ( c ) propose Health Assembly initial allocation committees items agenda , appropriate deferment item future Health Assembly ; ( ) transfer subsequently items agenda allocated committees one committee another , necessary ; ( e ) report additions agenda Rule    ; ( f ) coordinate work main committees committees established plenary meetings session ; ( g ) fix date adjournment session ; ( h ) otherwise facilitate orderly dispatch business session . _________   regard Rule , Eighth World Health Assembly ( resolution WHA .   (      ) ) adopted following interpretation : attendance members delegations Rule    limited delegations one members serving General Committee . RULES PROCEDURE HEALTH ASSEMBLY     MAIN COMMITTEES HEALTH ASSEMBLY Rule    main committees Health Assembly shall : ( ) Committee – deal predominantly programme budget matters ; ( b ) Committee B – deal predominantly administrative , financial legal matters . addition two main committees , Health Assembly may establish main committees may consider necessary . Health Assembly , consideration recommendations Board General Committee , shall allocate items agenda two main committees way provide appropriate balance work committees . Chairs main committees shall elected Health Assembly . Rule    delegation shall entitled represented main committee one members . may accompanied meetings committee one members , may accorded permission speak shall vote . main committee shall elect two Vice-Chairs Rapporteur . Rule    Rule    facilitate conduct business , main committee may designate additional Vice-Chair ad interim Chair Vice-Chairs available . Rule    Chair main committee shall relation meetings committee concerned powers duties President Health Assembly relation plenary meetings .     BASIC DOCUMENTS Rule    Meetings main committees subcommittees shall held public unless committee subcommittee concerned decides otherwise . Rule    main committee may set subcommittees subdivisions considers necessary.  Rule    members subcommittee shall appointed main committee concerned upon proposal Chair . member subcommittee unable present meeting may represented another member delegation . subcommittee shall elect officers . COMMITTEES HEALTH ASSEMBLY Rule    Health Assembly may appoint , authorize appointment , committee subdivision deems necessary . RAPPORTEURS Rule    committee , subcommittee subdivision may appoint among members one rapporteurs required . _________   Executive Board recommended establishment working parties Health Assembly restricted following purposes : (   ) formulate conclusion substantial agreement reached ( whether unanimously evident majority ) ; (   ) make clear state issues committee decision ; (   ) provide committee expert opinion relevant discussions .
